intro: Spartianthus, commonly known as the woolly spartia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Spartianthus thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
